title: Business Insider Daily Update
text:
5 things you need to know in SA business today

1. Workers at the airline catering company Air Chefs are striking from this morning, but SAA and other airlines say travellers don’t have to pack their own food - contingency plans are in place.

2. Meanwhile, Ethiopian Airlines said it would consider buying a stake in South African Airways - should government decide to sell equity in the struggling state carrier. More.

3. No major results expected this week – apart from Mondi, Zeder and PSG Konsult, while August’s mining and manufacturing data will be released on Thursday.

4. Vehicle exports from South Africa could reach a record R140 billion in 2019. More.

5. Zimbabwean fuel prices have been hiked by 26% and electricity will become 300%. Fuel prices in the southern African country have been going up every week, but this week's hike is the biggest jump to date.
description: All you need to know in SA business today.
